summary: An email from an FBI agent to a law enforcement contact regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case, providing background on the charges and investigation, and requesting assistance with serving a grand jury subpoena on a long-time associate of Epstein. The document outlines Epstein's criminal conduct and the strategy for approaching his associate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case, arrested and charged with sex trafficking of minor girls and conspiracy. The email details his method of operation, involving paying underage girls for sexual acts and recruiting them to bring other victims.

connections.description: Described as a long-time friend and associate with a decades-long business relationship. The FBI is investigating the nature of this relationship and MM's knowledge of Epstein's activities.

events.title: FBI Email Regarding Epstein Case and Subpoena
events.description: An FBI agent sends an email to a law enforcement contact providing background on the Epstein case and attaching a grand jury subpoena for an associate (MM).

events.title: Epstein's Arrest and Charges in SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein has been arrested and charged in the Southern District of New York with sex trafficking of minor girls and conspiracy. The charges relate to conduct in New York and Florida.

events.title: Epstein's Pattern of Abuse
events.description: For many years, including the early-mid 2000s, Epstein enticed dozens to hundreds of underage girls to engage in sexual activity with him in exchange for money, using a massage ruse at his properties.

events.title: Previous Florida Investigation and NPA
events.description: Epstein was previously investigated by the U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI in Florida, resulting in a non-prosecution agreement (NPA) for some of his conduct there. The SDNY charges are outside the scope of that agreement.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and charged in the Southern District of New York with sex trafficking of minor girls and conspiracy, facing up to 45 years in prison.
Epstein's modus operandi involved luring underage girls to his properties under the guise of giving a paid erotic massage, which he would then escalate into sexual activity.
Epstein used a recruitment scheme where victimized girls were paid to bring new girls to him, creating a pipeline of victims.
The FBI is actively investigating Epstein's associates, including a person referred to as 'MM', a long-time friend and business associate, and has prepared a grand jury subpoena for him.
The document notes that a previous non-prosecution agreement from a Florida investigation does not apply to the SDNY charges, which cover conduct beyond its scope.
